alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Forsyth; Guilford; Montgomery; Randolph; Stanly (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 07 at 6:01PM EDT until August 07 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM EDT FOR EASTERN FORSYTH...DAVIDSON...MONTGOMERY...RANDOLPH...STANLY AND GUILFORD COUNTIES... At 600 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Bethany to 9 miles southeast of Albemarle, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Greensboro, Winston-Salem, High Point, Asheboro, Lexington, Albemarle, Randleman, Troy, Badin Lake and North Carolina Zoo. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for central North Carolina. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Straight line winds can blow down trees, power lines, and damage mobile homes and other buildings. Seek shelter in a sturdy structure until the storm has passed. Stay away from windows as flying debris generated by damaging winds can be deadly. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Raleigh.

area.areaDesc: Davidson; Forsyth; Guilford; Montgomery; Randolph; Stanly
